title: Strictly Come Dancing 2019: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman dazzle
text:
They are the popular hosts of Strictly Come Dancing known for their stylish ensembles.

And Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman looked incredible as they returned to the ballroom for the third live show on Saturday.

Tess, 50, looked gorgeous in a navy, pastel pink and emerald green watercolour gown, which cinched in at her slender waist.

Leggy: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman looked incredible as they returned to the ballroom for the third live show on Saturday

Glamour: Tess, 50, looked gorgeous in a navy, pastel pink and emerald green watercolour gown, which cinched in at her slender waist

The dress featured a flowing skirt with a soaring thigh-split which showcased her toned legs.

The beauty teamed this with nude vertiginous heels.

Her tresses were styled in soft waves while her pretty features were enhanced with a rich palette of make-up.

Claudia, 47, donned a chic pearl-embellished asymmetric number with a near identical split skirt, and finished her look with heels.

Wow; The dress featured a flowing skirt with a soaring thigh-split which showcased her toned legs

Her raven tresses were styled sleek and straight while her pretty features were enhanced with her signature smoky eye and a scarlet lipstick.

Strictly Come Dancing kicked off its third live show on Saturday, as the couples took to the floor for the show's hotly-anticipated Movie Week.

And Michelle Visage and her dance partner Giovanni Pernice wowed with her performance as Liza Minelli's Sally Bowles from Cabaret for their quick-step routine.

The RuPaul's Drag Race judge, 51, was so impressive that the judging panel couldn't help but gush after she completed her performance.

Shirley Ballas was in awe, calling Michelle and Giovanni's routine was 'magnifique' and added: 'You smashed it on every level.'

'your character was off the chart it was absolutely brilliant,' she added.

Work it: Claudia, 47, donned a chic pearl-embellished asymmetric number with a near identical split skirt, and finished her look with heels

While Bruno Tonioli was full of praise as he called the pair's performance a 'showstopper' that was 'so clever' as it 'set up the character and the feel correctly', and said their quickstep was also 'refined and polished.' Even Craig Revel Horwood said they were 'absolutely amazing', while Motsi Mabuse claimed she was 'always looking forward to what [Michelle] would do.'

She added: 'You make it your own you own it, great start, great opening, lets go!'

Michelle and Giovanni came out on top with 35 points.

Alex Scott and Neil Jones went up next with the first Rumba performance of the show, with a Moana theme.

The judges praised Alex for the work she had put in for the dance, but did have a bit of constructive criticism for the pair.

Bruno recommended that she shouldn't have any 'hesitation' with her performance, and added: 'I think you do have it within you but it's not quite made that step, so come on honey show them.'

Shirley was delighted with the pair's contemporary version of the Rumba, as she said: 'If everyone else did the same dance, it would be boring.

'You're starting to find your inner strength and you're in your inner feeling, its not quite there but you're getting there.'

While Craig claimed that he could notice most of Alex's mistakes because she wasn't wearing any shoes, which 'magnifies the poor technique.'

Alex and Neil were awarded with a score of 23 by the judges.

The professional dancers opened the show with a delightful performance to Disney/Pixar classics The Incredibles, Up and Toy Story
description: Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman looked incredible as they returned to the ballroom for the third live show on Saturday.
